title: What are some songs that talk about hating someone because they don't think like me? - Quora

response.answer_text: 1. "Here" - Alessia CaraFor all the times your friends dragged you to a party in a hot, crowded room that smelled like Natty Light and B.O., Alessia's got you covered. From the dude puking in the corner to the one trying to make you dance, ("I don't dance, don't ask; I don't need a boyfriend." Preach it, girl.) this song's got the whole uncomfortable situation covered, and quite melodiously too, I might add. 2. "My House" - Flo RidaSomething tells me Flo Rida wouldn't consider himself an introvert, but popping champagne in my own house without having to wear heels to a second location sounds like my kind of party. Also, I would just love to sing "WELCOME TO MY HOUSE" to everyone who walked in the door. 3. "House Party" - Sam HuntAlong the same lines, Sam Hunt knows that his girl likes to kick it in her PJs, so he says, "If you're gonna be a homebody, we're gonna have a house party." That's right, we are and if bras aren't invited, even better. Think Flo and Sam would be amigos? 4. "Creep" - RadioheadOkay, so I'm not sure what this song is actually about, but I think most introverts can relate to the "What the hell am I doing here? I don't belong here," lyrics and overall otherworldly vibes the tune gives off. It's just so good. 5. "All My Friends" - SnakehipsThen there are the times your friends manage to drag you all the way to the club. Chances are you'll feel this song when it comes on. "All my friends are wasted, and I hate this club. Man, I drink too much. Another Friday wasted." 6. "Dark Blue" - Jack's MannequinHow's this for a throwback? You know your high school emo kid is psyched out her damn mind right now. "Have you ever been alone in a crowded room?" Why yes, yes I have good sir. And that's right, he wrote it before Taylor did. 7. "Existentialism on Prom Night" - Straylight RunI might've gone down a high school music rabbit hole after Jack's Mannequin made the list (I'm totes dating myself, aren't I?), but come one, even the title of this song screams, "I've been thinking myself in circles all night and I can't face humans right now." Vulnerable all knowing. Le sigh. 8. "I'm Shakin" - RooneyThis one's just so damn catchy. The seemingly out of place, "Never Ending Story" reference just gets me every time. 9. "Middle of Nowhere" - Hot Hot Heat"You didn't have to do it, but you did it to say that you didn't have to do it, but you would anyway." That's my kind of logic--so much analysis. 10. "Day 'n Night (Nightmare)" - Kid CudiI'm a huge Kid Cudi fan. He's my fave, especially because of this little collab with Haim, but he references his night terrors and antisocial behavior in plenty of his songs. Perhaps none as blatantly as this one though. "The lonely stoner seems to free his mind at night." 11. "Fool On The Hill" - The BeatlesYou could find an incredible Beatles song for just about any occasion or emotion you could ever want to convey and I came close to using "Nowhere Man" instead, but I just love this one. "Well on the way, head in a cloud, The man of a thousand voices talking perfectly loud, But nobody ever hears him Or the sound he appears to make." 12. "I Am A Rock" - Simon & GarfunkelThe next few might be a little more aggressive in a straight up antisocial/depressed kind of way, but they're excellent nonetheless. If you've ever escaped into a book, you might relate to this lyric: "I have my books and my poetry to protect me, I am shielded in my armor, Hiding in my room, safe within my womb." 13. "Day In Day Out" - Catch 22Switchin' it up with the ska now, y'all. "I don't need anyone, I don't need anyone, I don't need anyone to tell me what to feel." Yep, sounds about right. 14. "Solitude Is Bliss" - Tame ImpalaThis is the ultimate introvert's theme song, just look at that title. "Space around me where my soul can breathe, I've got body that my mind can leave, Nothing else matters, I don't care what I miss, Company's okay, Solitude is bliss." enjoy

Its all in the mind. For me I do not consider the word HATE, it's just a draw back where circumstances arise and two people do not get along. Songs are written by those who experience things in life and it comes to them naturally but that doesnt mean to say that the song was written for you, like I said its all in the mind and it appears to you that is your song.
